result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Lifetime Supervision of Serious Sex Offenders

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David A Stage Jr

records.addlTxt: AMENDED BONDS CAME BACK AS REFUSED TO SIGN

No contact with his wife NMS or child SMS-dob 7/16/20.  Defendant is not to consume or possess alcohol.  Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars taverns or liquor stores or any other establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol. No possession/consumption or use of illegal or illicit drugs, or any substance intended to use to alter mental state or mood.  Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  No possession of medications not prescribed to you by a physician. DE cannot possess firearms or any other dangerous weapons. Any employment will be within Rusk County only.  Bond concurrent with 22CF14.
Review hearing on May 5, 2023 at 08:00 am.
Review hearing on May 4, 2023 at 08:00 am.
Review hearing on May 3, 2023 at 08:00 am.
Motion hearing on April 14, 2023 at 12:45 pm.

9:31 AM Defendant David A Stage Jr appeared by video.  Attorney Matthew Krische appeared by video for David A Stage Jr.  Attorney Emily Nelson appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Heard along wtih 22CF14, 22CF91, both set for MH.  Atty Krische is seeking a bond modification, asking for a cash bond of $5000.00 and states reasons for this bond modification. State objects to any bond modifications, nothing has changed with the circumstances with the exception of victim vacating the home.  Atty Krische addresses the States response.  Victim AEK appears via phone, objects to any bond modification (22CF14). The court addresses parties as to any possible huber release while on bond, neither party believe that is possible.  The court will get a portion of the school record to parties, with some information redacted.  Atty requests one additional Status Hearing before setting for Trial.  Set 22CF14 for JT first.  Court will reduce bond to $20,000.00 cash.  Absolutely no contact with the victims. All other conditions of bond will remain.  Any job for DE will be in Rusk County only.  Bonds concurrent. Victims names/identifying information will be redacted.
Jury trial scheduled for May 3, 2023 at 08:00 am.
Motion hearing scheduled for April 14, 2023 at 12:45 pm.

Motion hearing on October 3, 2022 at 09:30 am.

9:02 AM Defendant David A Stage Jr appeared by video.  Attorney Matthew Krische appeared by video for David A Stage Jr.  Attorney Emily Nelson appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Nancy Hahn appears via zoom, victim appears via phone.  Atty Krische has filed a motion for records examination.  Set for Motion Hearing October 3, 2022 @ 9:30AM.
Motion hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Status conference on August 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on August 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on August 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.

1:10 PM Defendant David A Stage Jr appeared by video from RC Jail.  Attorney Matthew Krische appeared by video for David A Stage Jr.  Attorney Annette Barna in court for State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 22CF14, 22CF91. Atty Krische has filed a motion for bond modification, enters argument as to this, asking for a cash bond that's affordable for his client or a sign bond, DE does have full time employment with his current employer and will not reside at the home as NS resides their.  State argues bond, believes DE to be a flight risk, strongly objects to bond modification.  Court will deny the motion to modify bond in these cases. Adj 1:22PM

11:29 AM Defendant David A Stage Jr in court.  Attorney Matthew Krische in court for David A Stage Jr.  Attorney Emily Margaret Nelson in court for State of Wisconsin. Heard along with 22CF14, 22CF91. Time set for PH in each case.

22CF14- 11:31 AM State calls Deputy Bryce Baier, oath given.  Record shall reflect witness has identified the Defendant. Objection/DE reading from the report. Objection/sustained. 11:47am Cross. Objection/sustained. 11:50 Witness dismissed. Atty Krische enters argument.  Court finds PC/will bind over for Trial. 

22CF91-PH. State calls Deputy Bryce Baier, Witness under oath.  Direct by the State.  Witness has identified the Defendant. 11:59am Cross by Atty Krische.  12:00pm-Witness dismissed.  Argument entered by Defense.  The court finds PC, will bind over for JT. State will fine information within 30 days.  Set for Arraignment with new Judge that will be assigned.  Adj 12:03PM.
Defendant's Motion to Amend Bond filed by Atty Krische
Defendant's Motion to Amend Bond

Payable Number: 48226,
Receipt Number: 22R 001358,
Amount: $20.00
Bail/bond hearing on May 23, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on May 19, 2022 at 11:30 am.

1:46 PM Defendant David A Stage Jr in custody.  Attorney Matthew Krische appeared in person for David A Stage Jr. State appears by ADA Emily Nelson.  Heard along with 22CF14, 22CF91. Waive formal reading of the CC. Set for PH May 19, 2022 @ 11:30 am.  

22CF14-Bonds will be concurrent, no contact with AEK, JPS, MSZ will be added. Contact with KAS will be verbally and physically abuse free, no discussion of the case.

Bond argument in 22CF14-Atty Krische asking for a sign bond in these cases.  State responds, believes cash bond in necessary.  The court is satisfied with the cash bond, will make bonds concurrent with the NC's added. Adj 1:53pm
CASH BOND RETURNED AS REFUSED TO SIGN FROM THE JAIL
22GF83 consolidated into 22CF91
DE REFUSED TO SIGN

No contact with his wife NMS or child SMS-dob 7/16/20.  Defendant is not to consume or possess alcohol.  Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars taverns or liquor stores or any other establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol. No possession/consumption or use of illegal or illicit drugs, or any substance intended to use to alter mental state or mood.  Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  No possession of medications not prescribed to you by a physician. DE cannot possess firearms or any other dangerous weapons.. No contact with the residence.

1:09 PM Court calls the case.  Per PD Osberg DE is not eligible for PD services.  DE wishes to proceed without counsel. Defendant David Arthur Stage Jr appeared by video.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by Annette Barna.  Court instructs on DE without counsel. DE understands waiver of counsel, court will accept waiver of counsel. 

State asking for a cash bond of $50,000.00 as DE has other serious charges he is also facing. State will request no contact with the victim but believes the victim will be requesting otherwise, with the child and the home, absolute sobriety, no possession of dangerous weapons and no firearms where he is residing. 

DE makes a statement to the court.  DE has obtained Atty Matthew Kriesche in his other CF matter, will also have him on this case. 

Victim makes a statement, does not believe DE to be a flight risk, would like some anger management, wishes DE to be in his childs life, would like contact with him as they reside together, states he is a good father and she could use his help parenting the child. 

The court will impose a $50,000.00 cash bond. No contact with his wife or child.  Defendant is not to consume or possess alcohol.  Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars taverns or liquor stores or any other establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol. No possession/consumption or use of illegal or illicit drugs, or any substance intended to use to alter mental state or mood.  Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  No possession of medications not prescribed to you by a physician. DE cannot possess firearms or any other dangerous weapons.. No contact with the residence. Set for INit app April 26, 2022 @ 1:00PM.
Hearing on April 26, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Hold for bond hearing and victim notification.
